meanings.definition: A shrub of the rose family with small white flowers and red berries.
meanings.sent1: The squawbush in the garden bloomed beautifully this spring.
meanings.sent2: I picked some red berries from the squawbush for a snack.
meanings.sent3: The squawbush whispered secrets to the other plants in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a blooming squawbush in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The squawbush stood out among the greenery with its delicate white flowers.

meanings.definition: To cover or decorate with squawbush.
meanings.sent1: She decided to squawbush the fence to give it a natural look.
meanings.sent2: The artist squawbushed the entire room with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent3: The kids playfully squawbushed each other with flower petals.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter squawbushed the room with joy and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The garden was squawbushed with red berries, creating a festive atmosphere.
